2016-12-29 Spring Hello World

There is only 3 files you need to do for a simple hello world in spring:

1. Beans -- These are just POJO files

2. config.xml -- just specify how to create these beans in the context.

3. main() -- in here, you create an application context and obtain beans from the context. Then you can do whatever you want.

Remote: Setup a github repo Local: . git init . git clone . some repos ###https://jekyllthemes.io/

<a href=https://github.com/sharu725/thunder.git>Thunder</a>

###https://github.com/lukas-h/onepage.git ###https://git@github.com:johnotander/pixyll.git ###https://github.com/mattvh/jekyllthemes.git . git remote set-url origin git@github.com:undertree93/lc-leetcode.git . git checkout -b gh-pages . git push –set-upstream origin gh-pages . change _config.yml . change projects.xml . git commit -am “first time commit” . git push
